required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of SHR-1703 in Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics / Pharmacodynamics of Multiple Subcutaneous Injections of SHR-1703 in Asthmatic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: SHR-1703 is a monoclonal antibody under development for severe asthma. This study is the first study in patients with asthma. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics ，pharmacodynamics and immunogenic characteristics of multiple subcutaneous injections of SHR-1703 in asthmatic patients.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of adverse events in patients for SHR-1703
Severity of adverse events of SHR-1703

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the concentrations of multiple subcutaneous injections of SHR-1703 in asthmatic patients
Incidence of SHR-1703 anti drug antibody (ADA) for SHR-1703
Occurrence time of SHR-1703 anti drug antibody (ADA) for SHR-1703
Duration of SHR-1703 anti drug antibody (ADA) in patients for SHR-1703
Titer of SHR-1703 anti drug antibody (ADA) in patients for SHR-1703
The percentage change of absolute eosinophil count from baseline
